claim.claim-text: A mobile terminal, comprising: a communication unit(110) configured to: perform near field communication (NFC) with a detected object; and receive data from the object; a display(151); and a controller(180) configured to: monitor time duration for which the terminal(100) remains within a first threshold distance relative to the object; identify each of a plurality of time thresholds respectively occurring during the time duration; and cause the display to sequentially display a plurality of different data responsive to an occurrence of a corresponding time threshold of the plurality of time thresholds, wherein: each of the plurality of different data corresponds to one of the plurality of time thresholds; and the plurality of different data is based on the data received from the object.

The mobile terminal of claim 1, wherein the controller(180) is further configured to: start monitoring the time duration when the terminal(100) is positioned within a reference region with respect to the object, the first threshold distance substantially being a distance between a boundary of the reference region and the object; cause the display(151) to sequentially display the plurality of different data in order until last data is output while the terminal(100) remains within the reference region; and end monitoring the time duration when the terminal moves out of the reference region.

The mobile terminal of claim 2, further comprising an output unit(150) configured to output various signals,
wherein the controller is further configured to at least: output a first signal via the output unit(150) when the terminal(100) is within a second threshold distance relative to the first threshold distance; output a second signal via the output unit(150) when the terminal(100) moves out of the reference region; or output a third signal via the output unit(150) while the terminal(100) is positioned within the reference region.

The mobile terminal of one of any claims 1 and 2, wherein the controller(180) is further configured to cause the display(151) to display an indicator indicating remaining time for a current time threshold.

The mobile terminal of one of any claims 2 and 3, wherein the controller(180) is further configured to: determine that the terminal(100) is not positioned within the reference region; stop outputting data that is to follow currently displayed data when it is determined that the terminal(100) is not positioned within the reference region; and execute a function associated with the currently displayed data when the terminal moves out of the reference region.

The mobile terminal of claim 5, wherein the controller(180) is further configured to output guide information while the terminal(100) is positioned within the reference region, the guide information instructing to move the terminal(100) out of the reference region if the function associated with the currently displayed data is desired to be executed.

The mobile terminal of claim 6, wherein: the guide information comprises a first notification displayed at a region of the display(151); and the controller(180) is further configured to cause the display(151) to display a second notification at a region of the display(151) when the terminal(100) has moved out of the reference region, the second notification indicating that the function associated with the currently displayed data is to be executed.

The mobile terminal of one of any claims 1, 2 and 4 further comprising a user input unit(130) configured to receive input from a user, the user input unit(130) comprising at least a touchscreen, a keypad or a button,
wherein: the received data include one or more NFC Data Exchange Format (NDEF) records; and the controller(180) is further configured to: output, via the display(151), first screen information corresponding to a first NDEF record, among the received one or more NDEF records, during a first time threshold without receiving any further user input via the user input unit(130); and output, via the display, second screen information corresponding to a second NDEF record, among the received one or more NDEF records, during a second time threshold, which follows the first time threshold when the first time threshold expires, without receiving any further user input via the user input unit(130).

The mobile terminal of claim 8, wherein the controller(180) is further configured to: cause the display(151) to display one or more thumbnail images including information corresponding to the one or more NDEF records at a region of the display while displaying the first screen information, the one or more thumbnail images including a first thumbnail image including information corresponding to the second NDEF record; and cause the display(151) to display the second screen information before the first time threshold expires in response to an input for selecting the first thumbnail image received during the first time threshold.

The mobile terminal of one of any claims 1, 2, 4 and 8 wherein the controller(180) is further configured to: prompt to change a setting of the terminal(100) upon recognizing a location-specific object; and change the setting when: the terminal(100) is positioned within a preset boundary with respect to the location-specific object at least for a preset period of time after the prompting; or the terminal(100) moves out of the preset boundary after the prompting.

The method of claim 12, further comprising: starting monitoring the time duration when the terminal(100) is positioned within a reference region with respect to the object, the first threshold distance substantially being a distance between a boundary of the reference region and the object; sequentially displaying the plurality of different data in order until last data is output while the terminal(100) remains within the reference region; and ending monitoring the time duration when the terminal(100) moves out of the reference region.

The method of claim 13, further comprising at least: outputting a first signal via an output unit(150) of the terminal(100) when the terminal(100) is within a second threshold distance relative to the first threshold distance; outputting a second signal via the output unit(150) when the terminal(100) moves out of the reference region; or outputting a third signal via the output unit(150) while the terminal(100) is positioned within the reference region.

The method of one of any claims 13 and 14, further comprising: determining that the terminal(100) is not positioned within the reference region; stopping outputting data that is to follow currently displayed data when it is determined that the terminal(100) is not positioned within the reference region; and executing a function associated with the currently displayed data when the terminal(100) moves out of the reference region.
